---
status: public
shortDescription: "If-else is equivalent to sequence of two ifs"
shortCorrection: "If-else can behave differently from sequence of two ifs"
concepts:
  - Conditional
  - ControlFlow
related:
  - id: ElsIf
    relation: If as set of cases
  - id: ElseAlwaysExecutes
    relation: Similar
  - id: IfRequiresElse
    relation: If as two cases
inOtherPl:
  # - pl: JavaScript
  #   id: ConditionalIsSequence
  - pl: Python
    id: ConditionalIsSequence
spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["14.9"]
plVersion:
# from: jls8
# to: jls14
expressibleInNms:
  - id: ControlFlowAsGraph
    how: ifs-else vs. two consecutive ifs
text:
  - id: ofj6

  - id: ssj4

  - citationKey: chiodiniSurveyingUpperSecondaryTeachers2025

---

`if (c) A else B` is equivalent to `if (c) A; if (!c) B`.

frontmatter.shortDescription: If-else is equivalent to sequence of two ifs
frontmatter.shortCorrection: If-else can behave differently from sequence of two ifs
